conclusion: Identify the relevant states and their properties.
State A has pressure 1 x 10^5 Pa and volume 3 L.
State B has pressure 1 x 10^5 Pa and volume 4 L.
Use the Ideal Gas Law to relate temperature and state variables.
Write the ratio of the states using the Ideal Gas Law.
Substitute the known values into the equation.
Convert temperature from Celsius to Kelvin.
Substitute values into the equation: (1 x 10^5 Pa) x 3 L / 300.15 K = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x 4 L / T_B.
The temperature T_B of state B is 400.2 K.
